caller_intent: Juan called to resolve a $37 charge from 'force community loan' after canceling his insurance, claiming he was overcharged due to insufficient funds and requesting a refund.
resolution_steps: Cody acknowledged the charge and explained it was due to a timing conflict between the cancellation request and the auto-draft.
Cody clarified that the cancellation form was submitted on Monday at 8:27 AM, but the draft had already occurred on the same day.
Cody informed Juan that In Cova would refund the $37, but the overdraft fee was not their responsibility.
Cody emphasized that the delay was due to the cancellation being processed after the draft date.
knowledge_required: Insurance cancellation processes and auto-draft billing timelines
Understanding of insufficient funds fees and their handling
summary: Juan was charged $37 by 'force community loan' after canceling his insurance, believing the charge was due to insufficient funds. Cody explained the charge occurred because the cancellation was processed after the auto-draft on the same day. In Cova will refund the $37, but the overdraft fee is not covered. The call concluded with the agent confirming the refund process.
